lead_paragraph: A Paris court convicted 19 Islamic militants today for their roles in a network that channeled arms and false identity papers to insurgents who have been fighting a nine-year-old war to topple the government in Algeria. Five other defendants were acquitted at the two-month trial of supposed supporters of the Armed Islamic Group, a leading force in the civil war in Algeria, a former French colony.
abstract: Court in Paris, France, convicts 19 Islamic militants for roles in network that channeled arms and false identity papers to insurgents fighting nine-year-old war to topple government of Algeria (S)
